main.name: Ricky Woodruff
main.description: Competitive Programmer - iPhone App Developer - Bukkit Plugin Developer
main.bio: Hello! My name is Ricky Woodruff, and I am a sophomore Computer Science student at the University of Texas at Austin. Over the summer, I had the opportunity of taking classes at Stanford University where I was able to get an introduction to Artificial Intelligence, learn about responsive Client-Side Web Development, and gain insight into Silicon Valley's entrepreneurial realm.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: Undergraduate Computer Science major with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, and Machine Learning
Completed coursework in Artificial Intelligence, Entrepreneurship, and Web Development

work.title: iOS Development Instructor
work.description: Guided 36 middle school and high school students through the basics of full stack native iOS development by developing 3 iOS applications at Facebook and Stanford University campuses
work.description2: Utilized resources such as Google’s Firebase to develop the final social media application

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Configured a Raspberry Pi to work as the central operating system of a reconnaissance drone for the U.S. Military and collaborated with other engineers to transmit a low-latency video feed to the Microsoft HoloLens
work.description2: Enhanced an iOS project in Swift dedicated to improving users’ mental acuity

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Engineered the initial prototype for a military reconnaissance drone
work.description2: Audited a TSA “pat-down suit” by debugging Intel Edison board data packets with Wireshark

projects.title: Trinity Prep iPhone App
projects.category: Mobile App for Trinity Preparatory School students

projects.title: Bukkit Plugin Development
projects.category: Plugins I developed for Minecraft server owners
